column12: You study the enemy; looking for a gap in his defenses. Only when you find it do you strike.
column13: Strength + 2 vs. AC(melee) or Dexterity + 2 vs. AC(ranged).
column17: 1[W] damage(melee) or 1[W] damage(ranged). Increase damage to 2[W] (melee) or 2[W] (ranged) at 21st level.

column12: Let the fighter stand toe to toe with the monster. You prefer to make your attack; then withdraw to safer ground.
column19: If you move in the same turn after this attack; leaving the first square adjacent to the target does not provoke an opportunity attack from the target.

column12: You slink past your enemy's guard to make your attack; or you make your attack and then withdraw to a more advantageous position.
column20: Shift 1 square before or after you attack

column12: If the first attack doesn't kill it; the second one might.
column13: Strength vs. AC(melee; main weapon and off-hand weapon) or Dexterity vs. AC(ranged) two attacks
column17: 1[W] damage per attack. Increase damage to 2[W] at 21st level.

column11: Each enemy in burst you can see
column12: Enemies surround you--much to their chagrin; as you slash them to pieces with the ferocity of a wounded dire wolverine.
A well-placed shot to the leg leaves your enemy hobbled and bleeding.
column13: Strength vs. AC(melee) or Dexterity vs. AC(ranged)
column17: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage(melee) or 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage(ranged); and the target is slowed and takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends both)
column18: Half damage; no ongoing damage; and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
